PIC Code/Authenticate.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 ///@brief Authenication, xPL and web
00002 ///@file Authenticate.c
00003 
00004 #include "AES.h"
00005 #include "TCPIP Stack/TCPIP.h"
00006 #include "xPL.h"
00007 #include "SecuritySystem.h"
00008 
00009 #define AESBLOCKSIZE 16         /// AES Cypher block size setting
00010 #define MAXTIMEDIFFERENCE 120 /// difference in seconds between client time and internal time
00011 
00012 
00013 //******************************************************************************
00014 /** D E C L A R A T I O N S **************************************************/
00015 //******************************************************************************
00016 
00017 char RejectedPassword[USERPASSLENGTH]; ///< Tracks that last password that was rejected, useful when adding RFID tags
00018 
00019 //******************************************************************************
00020 /** P R I V A T E  P R O T O T Y P E S ***************************************/
00021 //******************************************************************************
00022 
00023 static void LoadUserNameEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) ;
00024 static void LoadUserPasswordEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber, int ReturnLength, int StartPosition) ;
00025 static void SaveUserPasswordEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) ;
00026 static void SaveUserNameEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) ;

00028 
00029 //*********************************************************************
00030 /**
00031  Called when receiving an xPL message that contains a user that needs to be checked.
00032  Authenticates the user by decoding the message (if AES enabled) and then calls Authenticate(); to check if this is a valid user.
00033  Return TRUE if the user was found and updates the UserID variable with the user name.
00034  
00035  @param Password char, the supplied password
00036  @return BOOL if authentication worked. global of UserID is also updated in the process  
00037  */
00038 
00039 BOOL xPLAuthenticate (char * Password) {
00040         
00041         unsigned char AESDecodeKey[AESBLOCKSIZE];               // AES Key
00042         unsigned char AESDecodeBlock[AESBLOCKSIZE];             // AES stuff
00043         unsigned char RawData[AESBLOCKSIZE * 2];                // 10 bytes of EPOC + 16 bytes of the admin password
00044         char UserPassword[17];                                                  // The password supplied, if AES enabled this is taken out of the decrypted data
00045         int ByteCopy, BlockNumber;
00046         DWORD MessageEPOC;                                                              // EPOC (time) contained in the message is AES is enabled
00047         
00048 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00049         putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPL message user authentication has started.\r\n");
00050 #endif
00051         
00052         if (xPLConfig.Use_AES == FALSE) {
00053                 // AES is not enabled
00054 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00055                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" AES is disables, no encryption on user feild\r\n");
00056 #endif
00057                 
00058                 if (Authenticate(Password) == FALSE) {
00059                         addxPLMessage (TB_SendInvalidUser);
00060                         return FALSE;
00061                 }
00062                 return TRUE;                            
00063         }
00064         
00065     // Load admin password
00066     memset(AESDecodeKey, '\0',  sizeof(AESDecodeBlock));
00067     LoadUserPasswordEEdata ((BYTE *) AESDecodeKey, 0, AESBLOCKSIZE, 0);
00068     
00069     // if password is less then 16, padd it out with spaces
00070     while (strlen(AESDecodeKey) < AESBLOCKSIZE)
00071             strcatpgm2ram(AESDecodeKey, (rom char *) " ");
00072     
00073 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00074         putsUART(AESDecodeKey);
00075         putrsUART((ROM char*)" <-16 byte Password for decryption\r\n");
00076 #endif
00077         
00078         // calculate the decode key
00079         AESCalcDecodeKey(*AESDecodeKey); 
00080         
00081 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00082         putsUART(AESDecodeKey);
00083         putrsUART((ROM char*)" <-16 byte decryption key after AEScalcDecodeKey\r\n");
00084 #endif
00085         
00086         // Decode the message and convert it back to pain text
00087         
00088         BlockNumber = 0;
00089         memset(RawData, '\0',sizeof(RawData));  
00090         while ((BlockNumber * AESBLOCKSIZE) < sizeof(RawData)) {
00091                 memset(AESDecodeBlock, '\0', sizeof(AESDecodeBlock));
00092                 for (ByteCopy = 0; ByteCopy < AESBLOCKSIZE; ByteCopy++) {
00093                         AESDecodeBlock[ByteCopy] = Password[ (BlockNumber * AESBLOCKSIZE) + ByteCopy];
00094                         if (AESDecodeBlock[ByteCopy] == '/0') {
00095                                 BlockNumber = 9; // we have found the end of the data
00096                                 break;
00097                         }       
00098                 }       
00099                 
00100 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00101                 putsUART(AESDecodeBlock);
00102                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" <-16 byte Block 2 be decoded\r\n");
00103 #endif
00104                 
00105                 AESDecode(*AESDecodeBlock, *AESDecodeKey);
00106                 
00107 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00108                 putsUART(AESDecodeBlock);
00109                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" <-16 byte result from decode\r\n");
00110 #endif
00111                 
00112                 strcat(RawData, AESDecodeBlock);
00113                 BlockNumber++;
00114         }       
00115         
00116 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00117         putsUART(RawData);
00118         putrsUART((ROM char*)" <-Decrypted output\r\n");
00119 #endif
00120         
00121 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00122         
00123         // Determine the time difference between this messgae and the system time.
00124         // AESDecodeKey is now going to be used as a temp string        
00125         memset(AESDecodeKey, '\0', sizeof(AESDecodeKey));
00126         memcpy(AESDecodeKey, RawData, 10); // 10 character EPOC
00127         MessageEPOC = atoi(AESDecodeKey);
00128         
00129         if (SNTPGetUTCSeconds() > MessageEPOC) {
00130                 if ((SNTPGetUTCSeconds() - MessageEPOC) > MAXTIMEDIFFERENCE) {
00131                         // Time stamp is to old
00132 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00133                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Time stamp is to old, message rejected\r\n");
00134 #endif
00135                         
00136                         // Send xPL message that there was an error with the time stamp
00137                         addxPLMessage (TB_SendInvalidUserTimestamp);
00138                         return FALSE;
00139                 }
00140         }
00141         else {
00142                 if ((MessageEPOC - SNTPGetUTCSeconds()) > MAXTIMEDIFFERENCE) {
00143                         // Time stamp is to far in the future
00144 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00145                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Time stamp is to far in the future, message rejected\r\n");
00146 #endif
00147                         
00148                         // Send xPL message that there was an error with the time stamp
00149                         addxPLMessage (TB_SendInvalidUserTimestamp);
00150                         return FALSE;           
00151                 }
00152         }
00153         
00154 #endif //#if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00155 
00156         
00157         // Lastly we check to see if the password is valid
00158         memset(UserPassword, '\0',sizeof(UserPassword));
00159         for (iCount=0; (iCount+10 < sizeof(RawData) && RawData[iCount+10] != '\0'); iCount++) {
00160                 UserPassword[iCount] = RawData[iCount + 10];
00161         }// for 
00162         
00163 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00164         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Decrypted password is:");
00165         putsUART(UserPassword);
00166         putrsUART((ROM char*)", passing to authentication module\r\n");
00167 #endif
00168         
00169         if (Authenticate(UserPassword) == FALSE) {
00170                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendInvalidUser);
00171                 return FALSE;
00172         }
00173         
00174         return TRUE;                            
00175         
00176         
00177 }//xPLAuthenticate
00178 
00179 
00180 //*********************************************************************
00181 /**
00182  Authenticates the user by checking the password. Populates the users name into UserID. Return TRUE if the user was found.
00183  \todo add config option to reject users from different subnet
00184  @param Password char
00185  @return BOOL if authentication worked. global of UserID is also updated in the process  
00186  */
00187 
00188 BOOL Authenticate (char * Password) {
00189         
00190     char UserPassword[USERPASSLENGTH+1];        
00191         memset(UserID, '\0',USERNAMELENGTH);
00192         
00193         // ensure we have something in the password to check.
00194         if (*Password == '\0') {
00195 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00196                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" INVALID, FAILED authentication\r\n");
00197 #endif
00198                 return FALSE;
00199         }
00200         
00201         
00202         // Override password
00203         if (!strcmppgm2ram((char*)Password, (ROM char*)"boo")) {
00204 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00205         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Override password used\r\n");
00206 #endif
00207                 strcpypgm2ram((char*)UserID, (ROM void*)"Boo");
00208                 return TRUE;
00209         }       
00210         
00211         
00212         
00213         for(iCount = 0; iCount < USERCOUNT; iCount++) {
00214             // cycle through all of the passwords until we find it
00215             LoadUserPasswordEEdata ((BYTE *) UserPassword, iCount, USERPASSLENGTH, 0);
00216             if (!strcmp((char*)Password, UserPassword)) {
00217                     LoadUserNameEEdata (UserID, iCount);
00218 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00219                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" User:");
00220                         putsUART(UserID);
00221                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" has passed authentication\r\n");
00222 #endif
00223                     return TRUE;
00224                         break;
00225                 }// UserName
00226         }// iCount
00227         
00228         
00229 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00230         putrsUART((ROM char*)" User:");
00231         putsUART(Password);
00232         putrsUART((ROM char*)" has FAILED authentication\r\n");
00233 #endif
00234         
00235         
00236         return FALSE;
00237         
00238 }
00239

00241 //*********************************************************************
00242 /**
00243  Dynamic variable that prints the user password that was last rejected
00244   ********************************************************************/
00245 
00246 void HTTPPrint_RejectPassword(void) {
00247         
00248         // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00249         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00250         
00251         // Make sure there's enough output space
00252         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < USERPASSLENGTH)
00253                 return;
00254     
00255     TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, RejectedPassword, USERPASSLENGTH);
00256     
00257     // Indicate that we're done
00258         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00259         return;
00260         
00261         
00262         
00263 }//HTTPPrint_UserName
00264

00266 //*********************************************************************
00267 /**
00268  Dynamic variable that prints the user name to the web page
00269  ********************************************************************/
00270 
00271 void HTTPPrint_UserName(WORD num) {
00272         
00273         char UserName[USERNAMELENGTH+1];
00274     
00275     UserName[USERNAMELENGTH] = '\0';
00276     
00277     // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00278         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00279         
00280         // Make sure there's enough output space
00281         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < USERNAMELENGTH)
00282                 return;
00283     
00284     LoadUserNameEEdata ((BYTE *)UserName, num) ; 
00285     
00286     TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, UserName, strlen(UserName));
00287     
00288     // Indicate that we're done
00289         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00290         return;
00291         
00292         
00293 }//HTTPPrint_UserName

00299 
00300 void HTTPPrint_UserPassword(WORD num) {
00301         
00302     char UserPassword[USERPASSLENGTH+1];
00303     
00304     UserPassword[USERPASSLENGTH] = '\0';
00305     
00306     // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00307         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00308         
00309         // Make sure there's enough output space
00310         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < USERPASSLENGTH)
00311                 return;
00312     
00313     LoadUserPasswordEEdata ((BYTE *)UserPassword, num,USERPASSLENGTH, 0) ;
00314     
00315     TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, UserPassword, strlen(UserPassword));
00316     
00317     // Indicate that we're done
00318         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00319         return;
00320 }
00321 
00322 //*********************************************************************
00323 /**
00324  Takes the user number and loads the password of that user into the pointer. The length can be limited for easy use in HTTPPrint
00325  @param  *p,  updates pointer with the output
00326  @param  UserNumber, the user number to return
00327  @param  ReturnLength, the number of characters to return
00328  @param  StartPosition, start returning characters after this position
00329  @return Null, returns values with *p
00330 
00331  ********************************************************************/
00332 
00333 void LoadUserPasswordEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber, int ReturnLength, int StartPosition) {
00334         
00335         int StartAddress;
00336         
00337         // make sure request is not out of range
00338         if (UserNumber >= USERCOUNT) {
00339                 *p = '\0';
00340 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00341                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"User ID:");
00342                 uitoa(UserNumber,  xPLMsgKey);
00343                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00344                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00345                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# User out of range,LoadUserPasswordEEdata \r\n");
00346 #endif
00347                 return;
00348         }       
00349         
00350         // find the begining of the users password
00351     StartAddress = (unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER + (unsigned int) (((USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH) * UserNumber) + USERNAMELENGTH);
00352     StartAddress += StartPosition;
00353         
00354         
00355         XEEReadArray ((DWORD) StartAddress, p , (BYTE) ReturnLength); 
00356         
00357 }
00358 
00359 //*********************************************************************
00360 /**
00361  Takes the user number and loads the name of that user into the pointer
00362  Note, It will read the full size of the feild.
00363 
00364  @param  *p, output feed into this pointer
00365  @param  UserNumber, user number to be outputed
00366 
00367  ********************************************************************/
00368 
00369 void LoadUserNameEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) {
00370         
00371         int StartAddress;
00372         char DebugOutput[3];
00373         
00374         // make sure request is not out of range
00375         if (UserNumber >= USERCOUNT) {
00376                 *p = '\0';
00377 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00378                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"User ID:");
00379                 uitoa(UserNumber,  DebugOutput);
00380                 putsUART(DebugOutput);
00381                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00382                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# User out of range,LoadUserNameEEdata \r\n");
00383 #endif
00384                 return;
00385         }       
00386         
00387         // find the begining of the users password
00388     StartAddress = (unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER + (unsigned int) ((USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH) * UserNumber);
00389     
00390     XEEReadArray ((DWORD) StartAddress, p , (BYTE) USERNAMELENGTH); 
00391         
00392         
00393 }
00394 
00395 
00396 //*********************************************************************
00397 /** Saves the data stored in the pointer into the password feild of the
00398  user held in EE prom Note, It will write the full size of the feild.
00399  @param  *p, data to be saved
00400  @param  UserNumber, user number to save data to
00401  ********************************************************************/
00402 
00403 void SaveUserPasswordEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) {
00404         
00405         int StartAddress;
00406         
00407         // make sure request is not out of range
00408         if (UserNumber >= USERCOUNT) {
00409                 *p = '\0';
00410 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00411                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"User ID:");
00412                 uitoa(UserNumber,  xPLMsgKey);
00413                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00414                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00415                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# User out of range,SaveUserPasswordEEdata \r\n");
00416 #endif
00417                 return;
00418         }       
00419         
00420         // find the begining of the users password
00421     StartAddress = (unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER + (unsigned int) (((USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH) * UserNumber) + USERNAMELENGTH);
00422         
00423 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00424         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Saving user password\r\n");
00425 #endif
00426         
00427         
00428         for(iCount = 0; iCount < USERPASSLENGTH; iCount++) {
00429                 //if(XEEBeginWrite(StartAddress + iCount) != XEE_SUCCESS )      
00430                 XEEBeginWrite(StartAddress + iCount); 
00431                 XEEWrite(p[iCount]);
00432                 XEEEndWrite();
00433                 while(XEEIsBusy());             
00434         }
00435         
00436 }
00437 
00438 
00439 //*********************************************************************
00440 /**
00441  Saves the data stored in the pointer into the name feild of the
00442  user held in EE prom.  Note, It will write the full size of the feild.
00443  @param  *p, name to be saved
00444  @param  UserNumber, user number to save data to
00445  ********************************************************************/
00446 
00447 void SaveUserNameEEdata (BYTE *p, int UserNumber) {
00448         
00449         int StartAddress;
00450         
00451         // make sure request is not out of range
00452         if (UserNumber >= USERCOUNT) {
00453                 *p = '\0';
00454 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00455                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"User ID:");
00456                 uitoa(UserNumber,  xPLMsgKey);
00457                 putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00458                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00459                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# User out of range,SaveUserPasswordEEdata \r\n");
00460 #endif
00461                 return;
00462         }       
00463         
00464         // find the begining of the users password
00465     StartAddress = (unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER + (unsigned int) ((USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH) * UserNumber);
00466     
00467 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00468         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Saving user name\r\n");
00469 #endif
00470         
00471         for(iCount = 0; iCount < USERNAMELENGTH; iCount++) {
00472                 //      if(XEEBeginWrite(StartAddress + iCount) != XEE_SUCCESS )
00473                 XEEBeginWrite(StartAddress + iCount);
00474                 XEEWrite(p[iCount]);
00475                 XEEEndWrite();
00476                 while(XEEIsBusy());             
00477         }
00478         
00479 }
00480 
00481 //*********************************************************************
00482 /** 
00483  HTTP GET from the user admin web page, this updates the Name and Password
00484  of the user in EE prom
00485  @param  *ptr, from HTTP (GET) stack
00486  ********************************************************************/
00487 void ModifyUser (BYTE *ptr) {
00488         
00489         int UserID, iCount;
00490         char NewUserName[USERNAMELENGTH+1];
00491         char NewUserPassword[USERPASSLENGTH+1];
00492         
00493         // clear out the memory just in case
00494         memset (NewUserName, '\0', USERNAMELENGTH+1);
00495         memset (NewUserPassword, '\0', USERPASSLENGTH+1);
00496         
00497         //ID of the user being updated
00498         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"id");
00499         if(*ptr) 
00500                 UserID = DecodeIntFromGET(ptr,  (rom char *)"User ID");
00501         
00502         // User Name
00503         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"N");
00504         if(*ptr) {
00505                 for(iCount = 0;iCount < USERNAMELENGTH; iCount++) {
00506                         NewUserName[iCount] = *ptr;
00507                         if (*ptr != '\0') ptr++;
00508                 }// for 
00509         }
00510         
00511         // User Password
00512         ptr = HTTPGetROMArg(curHTTP.data, (ROM BYTE *)"P");
00513         if(*ptr) {
00514                 for(iCount = 0;iCount < USERPASSLENGTH; iCount++) {
00515                         NewUserPassword[iCount] = *ptr;
00516                         //if (*ptr != '\0') 
00517                         ptr++;
00518                 }// for 
00519         }
00520         
00521         
00522 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00523         putrsUART((ROM char*)"NewUserName:");
00524         putsUART(NewUserName);
00525         putrsUART((ROM char*)" strlen:");
00526         uitoa(strlen(NewUserName),  xPLMsgKey);
00527         putsUART(xPLMsgKey);            
00528         putrsUART((ROM char*)" : ");
00529         putrsUART((ROM char*)"NewUserPassword:");
00530         putsUART(NewUserPassword);
00531         putrsUART((ROM char*)" strlen:");
00532         uitoa(strlen(NewUserPassword),  xPLMsgKey);
00533         putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
00534         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00535         
00536 #endif
00537         
00538         SaveUserNameEEdata (NewUserName, UserID) ;
00539         
00540         SaveUserPasswordEEdata (NewUserPassword, UserID) ;
00541         
00542         strcpypgm2ram((char*)curHTTP.data, (ROM void*)"/admin/users.htm");
00543         curHTTP.httpStatus = HTTP_REDIRECT;                     
00544         
00545         
00546         
00547 } //ModifyUser
00548 
00549 //*********************************************************************
00550 /* 
00551  This is a part of the TCP/IP stack that is used to determin what access
00552  is needed for files being pulled form the HTTP2 web server. Read the MC doco
00553  @param * cFile, file name
00554  ********************************************************************/
00555 
00556 BYTE HTTPNeedsAuth(BYTE* cFile) {
00557         
00558     // Don't use strcmp here, because cFile has additional path info
00559     
00560 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00561         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Web page being loaded:");
00562         putsUART(cFile);
00563 #endif
00564     
00565     // All pages that need admin access are stored in the file call admin
00566     if(!memcmppgm2ram((void*)cFile, (ROM void*)"admin", 5)) {
00567 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00568                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Page needs admin access\r\n");
00569 #endif
00570                 return HTTP_AUTH_ADMIN;
00571         }    
00572     
00573 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00574         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Page needs general access\r\n"); 
00575 #endif
00576     return HTTP_AUTH_OTHER;
00577         
00578         
00579 }  //HTTPNeedsAuth
00580 
00581 
00582 
00583 
00584 /*********************************************************************
00585  This is a part of the TCP/IP stack that is used to if the supplied user name
00586  and password are valid for the page being accessed. Read the MC doco for more
00587  @param * cUser, user supplied user name
00588  @param * cPass, user supplied password
00589  @return 0x80 or above grants access, anything below prevents access
00590  ********************************************************************/
00591 
00592 BYTE HTTPCheckAuth(BYTE* cUser, BYTE* cPass) {
00593         
00594     char UserPassword[USERPASSLENGTH+1];
00595     char UserName[USERPASSLENGTH+1];
00596     
00597     if (!strcmppgm2ram((char*)cPass, (ROM char*)"boo")) {
00598 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00599                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Web Override password used\r\n");
00600 #endif
00601         return 0xff;
00602     }   
00603         
00604     // Check if admin access is required
00605     if(curHTTP.isAuthorized == HTTP_AUTH_ADMIN) {
00606                 memset(UserPassword, '\0',  USERPASSLENGTH);
00607                 LoadUserPasswordEEdata ((BYTE *) UserPassword, 0, USERPASSLENGTH, 0);
00608                 LoadUserNameEEdata (UserName, 0);
00609                 if ( (!strcmp((char*)cUser, UserName)) &&
00610                 (!strcmp((char*)cPass, UserPassword)) ) {
00611                         
00612 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00613                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Web Admin user accpeted\r\n");
00614 #endif
00615                         return 0xff;
00616                 }
00617 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00618                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Web Admin password rejected\r\n");
00619 #endif
00620                 return 0x00;
00621         }// HTTP_AUTH_ADMIN
00622         
00623     else {
00624                 for(iCount = 0; iCount < USERCOUNT; iCount++) {
00625                     LoadUserNameEEdata (UserName, iCount);
00626                     if (!strcmp((char*)cUser, UserName)) {
00627 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00628                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Web User name accepted,looking for password");
00629 #endif
00630                             LoadUserPasswordEEdata ((BYTE *) UserPassword, iCount, USERPASSLENGTH, 0);
00631                             if (!strcmp((char*)cPass, UserPassword)) {
00632 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00633                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Accepted\r\n");
00634 #endif
00635                                         return 0x80;
00636                                 }
00637                         }// UserName
00638                 }// iCount
00639             
00640         } // isAuthorized
00641         
00642 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00643         putrsUART((ROM char*)" rejected\r\n");
00644 #endif
00645         
00646     return 0x00;
00647     
00648         
00649 }

00652 //******************************************************************************
00653 /**
00654 
00655 This is a debug function that will print the entire contents of the EEdata to a web page.
00656 Handy when you can not figure what the hell is going on ;)
00657 */
00658 void HTTPPrint_PrintEEProm(WORD num) {
00659         
00660         // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00661         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00662         
00663         // Make sure there's enough output space
00664         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < 50)
00665                 return;
00666     
00667     memset (xPLMsgValue, '\0', xPLMSGVALUELENGTH);
00668     
00669     XEEReadArray ((DWORD) num, xPLMsgValue , (BYTE) 50); 
00670     
00671     TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, xPLMsgValue, 50);
00672     
00673     // Indicate that we're done
00674         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00675         return;
00676         
00677         
00678 }//HTTPPrint_UserName
00679 
00680 //******************************************************************************
00681 //*                                The End
00682 //******************************************************************************
00683 //#endif
